poem:
Hurricanes Now Have an Oracle

In the whir of pixels and data streams,  
a storm's destiny unfurls before us—  
DeepMind sees the unseen,  
a digital prophet foretelling  
the dance of wind and water,  
urging us to listen to the quiet hum  
of certainty and chance  
as the tempest takes its aim.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How Google’s DeepMind tool is ‘more quickly’ forecasting hurricane behavior When then Tropical Storm Melissa was churning south of Haiti, Philippe Papin, a National Hurricane Center (NHC) meteorologist, had confidence it was about to grow into a monster hurricane. As the lead forecaster on duty, he predicted that in just 24 hours the storm would become a category 4 hurricane and begin a turn towards the coast of Jamaica. No NHC forecaster had ever issued". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
